algorithm_technique: Sorting and Two Pointers to efficiently count pairs within a range
problem_summary_simple: Count pairs (i, j) in an array where nums[i] + nums[j] is within a given range.
problem_summary_technical: Sorts the array and uses a two-pointer approach to count pairs whose sum falls within [lower, upper].
key_insights: Sorting the array is key to enabling the two-pointer approach.
The problem can be solved by finding the count of pairs <= upper and subtracting the count of pairs < lower.
The `count(x)` helper function efficiently finds pairs summing up to at most `x`.
